item.title: Manager, Global AML Risk Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Global AML Risk Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

To join the Global AML Risk Analytics team as a manager with no direct reports who will provide risk assessments to mitigate the AML risk in portfolios of clients who present an elevated level of risk (financial & reputational) and continuously look for opportunities to provide more relevant and valuable intelligence to the Global AML program (transaction monitoring, Financial Investigation Unit, Advisory, high risk client).

What will you do?

  • Provide risk assessments on various topics with a financial-crimes lens
  • Conduct thorough research using internal/external sources
  • Conduct thorough data analysis with a data literacy skills/investigative mindset
  • Demonstrate the ability to tell a meaningful story from analysis with a financial-crimes lens
  • Demonstrate the ability to utilize effective charts from analysis
  • Demonstrate the ability to recognize opportunities to improve risk mitigation in various areas; monitoring rules, models, periodic assessments, data enrichments, policies, etc.

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have

  • 3+ years of anti-money laundering investigation background
  • Experience with various financial crime typologies
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Proficient with Excel
  • Problem solving skills

Nice to Have

  • Data literacy skills
  • Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist designation
  • BSC or relevant subject matter area
  • Proficient with SQL or SAS

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities  
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies
  • The successful candidate will need to establish and maintain productive working relationships with Advisors and individuals at all levels, both internally and externally.

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Group Risk Management

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

2023-07-18

Application Deadline:

item.title: Sr Data Analyst (Term)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr Data Analyst (Term)

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

The Sr Data Analyst (1 year contract), will manage the development, implementation, and support of business analytics initiatives within special projects reporting to the RBC Advice Centre Analytics team. Applies experience and seasoned knowledge, skills, and practices by building requirements, ensuring data quality, interpreting data, and delivering insights and visualizations.

What will you do?

  • Retrieve, clean and organize large data sets from multiple sources.

  • Conduct data analysis to derive meaningful insights and actionable recommendations.

  • Ensure data integrity and accuracy by identifying and addressing data quality issues.

  • Collaborate with data engineers to source and understand new and existing data feeds.

  • Collaborate with project team to create and understand business requirements and align data analysis with organizational goals.

  • Develop and maintain dashboards using Tableau to provide rich and actionable insights.

  • Interpret data findings and communicate insights in a clear and concise manner to non-technical stakeholders.

What you need to succeed?

Must Have:

  • Undergraduate degree in computer science or similar quantitative field.

  • 2+ years experience in data analytics, data science, data modelling, or data visualization.

  • Strong understanding of data validation and data quality concepts.

  • Proficiency in SQL, databases, and data structures.

  • Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.

  • Proficiency in Python, or similar programming languages used for data analysis.

  • Professional communication skills with the ability to collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Nice to Have

  • Experience with the Hadoop ecosystem (HDFS, Hive, Spark) is a plus.

  • Experience with project based or agile teams is a plus.

  • Experience in Advice Centre and/or Financial Institutions

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A world-class training program in financial services

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

Job Summary

item.title: Fall 2023 Student - Personal & Commercial Banking - Data Analyst (4 months)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Fall 2023 Student - Personal & Commercial Banking - Data Analyst (4 months)

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Data Analyst Co-op will work closely with the Corporate Client Group (CCG) National Operation’s Data Analytics team to support the business with the management of data, reporting and process improvement initiatives. The incumbent should possess data and management information related knowledge and should be familiar with MS Excel and Access. Strong problem solving, time management and attention to details will help ensure success in this role. RBC CCG National Operations supports CCG’s planning, directing, and overseeing their operational policies, rules, initiatives, and goals. The CCG team is responsible for meeting annually established targets for revenues and returns, providing advice to our partners along with broader RBC relationship goals, while the National Operations team helps & supports the group execute long-term and short-term plans

What will you do?

  • Support the implementation of robust database and reporting systems for the CCG team and senior management
  • Fulfill ad-hoc and periodic data requests based on business requirements
  • Analyze data for useful insights and build meaningful dashboards & data visualizations
  • Automate reporting processes to help the team save resources
  • Perform data mining, cleanup and investigate discrepancies to enhance data quality
  • Support database administration activities and troubleshoot user inquiries
  • Document and diagram key system and data management processes

  • What do you need to succeed?

    Must-have

  • 3rd or 4th year student with a minimum of one Co-Op placement of relatable experience
  • Undergraduate degree in Management Information Systems, Business Administration, Computer Science or Engineering
  • Intermediate level of MS Office with a focus on Excel and strong familiarity with Access
  • Related knowledge and experience in database and data management principals
  • Ability to perform well under pressure, meet time sensitive deadlines, and prioritize work
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Team player and also able to work independently
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Proven capabilities in effective management of tasks and delivering high quality work

Nice-to-have

  • VBA
  • Tableau
  • Python

What’s in it for you?

This is a great opportunity for students who are interested in expanding their knowledge and developing skills in data analytics, system improvement and the banking industry. Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, and progressive environment
  • Opportunities to learn and grow through challenging work
  • Being part of a great organization that values inclusion and diversity

Job Summary

Participates in and supports the operational activities of a business unit. Applies experience and complete working knowledge of the job and policies/practices to perform a combination of routine tasks and varied administrative/operational assignments.

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

37.5

Full time

Personal and Commercial Banking

item.title: Associate, Client Experience Group
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate, Client Experience Group

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

This role includes client-facing responsibilities, as well as collaboration with KYC, Onboarding, Account Management, Business Management, Sales Coverage and trading desks, etc. This role is multifaceted and involves adapting quickly to changing priorities and requirements while working with various stakeholders to optimize the client experience and meet RBC’s high-standards of success.

What will you do?

  • Client Questionnaires: Work with clients and internal stakeholders to complete inbound client questionnaires sent to RBC; Questionnaires must be completed in a timely manner and ongoing communication to clients with updates is critical to the maintenance of strong client/broker relationships.
  • Client Outreach: Lead and manage client outreach initiatives relating to regulatory communications, KYC, desk/product-specific messages to RBC’s broad client population
  • Member of a global Client Experience Group responsible for the onboarding of clients primarily focused on onboarding requests from Canada into all RBC locations.
  • Manage client lifecycle projects across the regional functional teams (KYC, AML, Legal, Operations, IT, Credit, Docs, Risk) to ensure smooth and efficient experience for the client and Sales.
  • Client Contact Management: Provide tailored client contacts for a number of outreach initiatives; Contribute to the maintenance of RBC’s client contact data.
  • Collaborate with various internal teams on projects and ad-hoc requests.
  • Review and comply with Royal Bank of Canada policies applicable to your business activities.
  • Proactively identify opportunities to enhance, streamline and automate processes

What you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Bachelor Degree in Business, Finance, or a relevant field of study

  • Excellent communicator, excel proficiency, strong organizational and time management skills, stakeholder management

  • Capital Markets experience

  • Relationship management experience,

  • Client management experience,

  • Basic data management competencies,

Nice-to-have

  • CSC Certification
  • Capital Markets experience

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities 
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Flexible work/life balance options

item.title: Quantitative Research Engineer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Quantitative Research Engineer

Job Description

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Quantitative Research Engineer to join the Quantitative Investments team at RBC Global Asset Management. As a Quantitative Research Engineer, you will collect, gather, clean, and shepherd data through alpha research, portfolio optimization, backtesting, and visualization. Your success and that of the team will be driven by your expertise in quantitative methods, financial data analysis, data validation, data governance, and data visualization combined with your passion for systematic quantitative investing and deep desire to explore and understand both established and novel financial datasets and internally derived data. You will report to the Head of Research, Quantitative Investments.

The Quantitative Investments team employs a systematic quantitative approach to the management of equity strategies implemented via mutual funds, hedge funds, segregated accounts and ETFs. The team takes a multi-factor approach to building and managing investment solutions. The models are data-driven and grounded in sound fundamental and economic rationale. It is a highly collaborative environment in which the research, portfolio management and systems development teams constantly interact. The team manages CAD$20bn of client investments.

What will you do?

  • Identify, acquire, and maintain diverse datasets to support alpha research and portfolio management of systematic equity strategies, including pricing data, fundamental accounting data, and alternative data

  • Verify and, where possible, improve the accuracy and completeness of historical datasets required for backtesting and other research purposes. Propose and document key assumptions required when building historical datasets

  • Ensure data is fit for purpose, clean, complete, and implement data validation processes to identify, flag, and rectify discrepancies or anomalies in data on an ongoing basis

  • Create data documentation and metadata to ensure data transparency and work with quantitative developers to ensure data is available to users via easy-to-use tools and APIs

  • Contribute to research engineering efforts to develop, maintain and enhance the team’s suite of visualization dashboards

  • Perform complex data analysis using advanced data manipulation techniques in Tableau, SQL, Python, Matlab, and related tools

  • Embody the following cultural edges: curious, open-minded and adaptable; eager to learn and motivated to continually improve; driven by the sense of urgency required to thrive in an era of rapid disruption; highly collaborative; and committed to a rigorous and scientific approach

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have

  • A passion for data and data-driven investment analysis

  • Bachelor’s degree in quantitative finance, statistics/machine learning, engineering, data science, engineering, or a related field

  • 3+ years of experience in the financial industry working with financial data; experience with equity data is strongly preferred; buy-side investing experience is a plus

  • Strong understanding of key mathematical and statistical techniques that are used in quantitative investments including portfolio optimization, risk management and performance analysis

  • Expertise in data governance, data validation, and data management processes

  • Strong programming skills in SQL, Python, and Matlab with experience in data manipulation and analysis. Proficiency in Tableau or other data visualization tools (Qlik, PowerBI, etc.), with a strong understanding of best practices in data visualization and dashboard design

  • Strong collaboration skills and a pro-active approach to communication. Ability to deliver accurate results that have impact on tight deadlines

Nice to Have

  • Master’s degree in quantitative finance, statistics/machine learning, engineering, data science, engineering, or a related field

  • Completion or enrollment in CFA

  • Experience working with modern cloud-based data ecosystem

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Flexible work/life balance options

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities  

  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Wealth Management

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

2023-07-10

2023-08-01

item.title: Manager, Reporting, Automation & Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Reporting, Automation & Analyst

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC is currently recruiting for the exciting role of Manager, Reporting & Analytics. In this role, you will work directly with product / client partners in Client Profile Segment Team, especially the Newcomer & Cultural Client teams, to fulfill the following critical roles:

  • Support information-based business decisions by identifying, understanding, capturing, organizing, presenting, and disseminating data trends.
  • Work with business partners to grow profitable relationships with our clients and create sustainable value for RBC shareholders.

What will you do?

  • Participate in strategy meetings to provide input, gather and document business requirements, and help formulate analytical framework.
  • Influence the approach to answering business questions with deep RBC product insights.
  • Seek out new ways to engineer and manufacture best-in-class standard reports to showcase insights and support tactics.
  • Increase the standardization and efficiency of regular reporting.
  • Manage day-to-day workflow and negotiate realistic timelines.
  • Participate actively in self and peer development relating to financial products, operational processes, relationship management, and technology enhancement.
  • Ensure compliance and privacy guidelines are strictly adhered to.

Must-have:

  • 3 years of hands on experience with large relational databases and working experience with multiple querying tools such as native SQL, SAS, BI/Query
  • Proven technical experience with Tableau (desktop and server), UNIX and Windows integrated environments.
  • Be effective and equally conversant in business and technical environments.
  • Strong, innate, business and data acumen.
  • Applied data validation mechanisms.
  • Ability to thrive when working under pressure
  • Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or other quantitative discipline.

Nice-to-have:

  • Knowledge of Teradata or DB2 is definite asset.
  • Demonstrated leadership in cross-functional environment.
  • Experience with developing reports using OLAP tools.
  • Experience with financial products and services and their corresponding data.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Opportunity to learn and apply new businesses, techniques, and ideas.
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities.

item.title: Director, Enterprise Model Risk Management
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, Enterprise Model Risk Management

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As Director, Enterprise Model Risk Management (EMRM) in our Group Risk Management (GRM) team, you will lead and execute the validation of the Bank’s enterprise-wide credit risk rating systems and methodologies, with focus on Wholesale credit risk systems including validation of Wholesale criteria paper models and replication to ensure integrity of ratings used for Basel compliance, capital accuracy, risk management, credit provisioning, and stress testing processes. You will develop and implement tools and methodologies required to underpin credit risk systems validation, and provide insightful robust analyses of credit risk systems validation.

What will you do?

  • Ensure efficient coordination and execution of Wholesale credit risk systems model validation processes and provide insightful and robust analyses of validation results
  • Ensure execution and documentation of appropriate qualitative and quantitative tests relating to Wholesale criteria papers, including review of logic and conceptual soundness of Wholesale criteria paper models and their inputs, accuracy, sensitivity, backtesting, benchmarking and analysis of the use of the criteria paper models
  • Develop and enhance approaches tailored to timelines and data availability, utilizing detailed or 80/20 solutions, and quantitative and/or qualitative approaches, as appropriate
  • Deliver validation findings and elicit feedback and remediation action plans / solutions from model stakeholders
  • Ensure project and risk objectives are accomplished within approved timeframes and complied with regulatory requirements, model risk policy and model operating standards
  • Perform a wide range of data reconciliations and analyses, e.g. organizing, interpreting and analyzing data using various statistical techniques catered for validation purposes   
  • Lead a high performing team and provide focus and clarity in establishing individual goals, driving performance management, supporting career development and rewarding strong performance
  • Complete ad hoc analytical or empirical projects

What do you need to succeed?

Must-Have

  • 7+ years of analytical and quantitative experience with a financial institution, in a related role such as a risk manager, a model developer/validator or data miner/analyst
  • Strong familiarity with design, development, and/or application of credit risk rating methodologies
  • Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline such as computer science/information system, statistics, econometrics and/or a relevant professional qualification
  • Understand various data systems (e.g. Newton/CNB Newton, CCMS, CMS, Probe, Axiom, EBR, ESN, WCRD etc.) structures/processes and how they affect inputs and outputs of credit risk modelling/validation data
  • Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills
  • Strong conceptual, analytical, detailed oriented and problem solving skills
  • Strong computer skills (SQL, Python and Microsoft Office Suite required; SAS strongly preferred)
  • Execute with urgency while maintaining quality and efficiency
  • Adapt to shifting priorities, coupled with a sense of urgency

Nice-to-Have

  • CFA, CPA, or FRM designations
  • Ability to communicate, verbally and in writing, complex concepts to a non-technical audience
  • Exposure to credit risk system design and Basel parameter estimation is an asset
  • Ability to work in Unix, Teradata Data Warehouse and/or Data Lake environments
  • Ability to work with numerous data and IT infrastructures
  • Proactive learning and working skills

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact 
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

Directs and coordinates risk management projects such as regulatory reviews, inspections, audits, etc. within the department. Manages activities through senior managers and managers and implements corporate and divisional strategic plans and budgets.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Group Risk Management

Job Type:

Regular

Salaried

2023-03-17

2023-08-07

item.title: Associate/VP - Quants
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate/VP - Quants

Job Description

WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?

As a front office quantitative analyst supporting the Commodities business, the candidate will be responsible for the provision of quantitative tools, analysis, and general analytical support to the trading desk. The RBC Quant team is responsible in developing & supporting next generation trading strategies and is the cornerstone of our Macro Quantitative Investment Strategies (Macro-QIS) business.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?

  • Development and implementation of tools to support trading desk, quantitative strategies infrastructure and risk management activities.
  • Gather new requirements from the trading desk and manage delivery of solutions through quant libraries and associated IT systems.
  • Maintenance and improvement of existing pricing tools and operational framework.
  • Provide general day-to-day quantitative support to trading desk.
  • Carry out special projects related to pricing models, trades, and risk management.
  • Assistance with the pricing of new products and feasibility of modelling approaches.
  • Provide desk-based research assistance as required.
  • Co-ordination with risk and functional teams as part of the process of submitting front office developed models for vetting and use in the bank\'s risk framework.
  • Help to recruit, retain and develop top talent.

WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?

 Must have:

  • Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline.
  • Advanced qualifications in mathematical finance and computing.
  • Strong written and oral communication.
  • At least 2 years’ experience in a similar role.
  • Programing: Python, C++, SQL.
  • Knowledge of derivative products and associated valuation methodologies.

Nice-to-have: 

  • Knowledge of Commodities, FX, and Rates derivatives.
  • Knowledge of Macro quantitative strategies and back-testing

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • A world-class training program in financial services.
  • Flexible work/life balance options.
  • Opportunities to do challenging work.

ROAR - 559979033

#TECHPJ

item.title: Senior Risk Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Risk Analyst

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The C&C Senior Risk Analyst will be part of RBC Clearing & Custody, a fast-growing business channel.  This role will interact with C&C firms, along with internal personnel, on key financial risk items related to the C&C business.  This role will work closely with C&C Risk Manager, as well as with Senior C&C Management.

What will you do?

  • Review daily risk reports, identify issues of concern, and resolve and/or escalate accordingly
  • Review financial statements and Focus reports for existing firms and identify trends, variances, etc.
  • Utilize applicable monitoring tools for the review of proprietary trading by C&C client firms
  • Monitor C&C Market Access Rule (MAR) and ACT trading limits proactively escalating limit breach concerns to interested parties as appropriate
  • Work closely with C&C firms, along with internal C&C staff, on understanding new and/or proposed C&C firm activities and associated risks
  • Document new firm risk profiles, including firm snapshot and anticipated trading activities, which are used to incorporate risk limits for C&C Risk review process
  • Function as a liaison during new firm conversion process for new C&C firms with respects to risk limits and risk set-up process
  • Escalate risk concerns and limit increases appropriately, as defined within the delegation of authority matrix
  • Other project work, analysis assignments and duties as assigned

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Risk Management experience in a Broker-Dealer or Financial Services firm
  • Ability to work and communicate with all levels of management, as well as with C&C firms
  • Ability to work independently and under pressure, all while adhering to deadlines and tight schedules
  • Ability to influence others and convey difficult messages in a clear and concise manner
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills

Nice-to-have

  • Series 7 and/or other advance licenses
  • Risk Management / Credit / Operations Background
  • Ability to adapt to an ever changing, fast paced environment

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities  
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business

Job Summary

•The Risk Analyst is responsible for reviewing, monitoring, and reporting financial risk associated with the Clearing & Custody business channel.
•This position will work closely with Risk Management personnel to analyze, understand, quantify and minimize financial risk to the business.

Minneapolis, Minnesota, United States of America

item.title: Real Estate Finance Risk Controls Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Real Estate Finance Risk Controls Analyst

Job Description

  • Assists in developing technology-based tools and performs data analysis to monitor, measure, and manage market and derivatives risks.
  • Assists in developing action plans to resolve issues. Re-designs processes to better manage, measure, and monitor market and derivatives risks.
  • Implements routine research and evaluation of the investments organization, business activities, and market and derivatives risk; assists in monitoring risk management policies, procedures, limits, and guidelines.
  • Participates in monitoring market risk to ensure that they are within market and derivatives risk thresholds, limits, and constraints. Explains market and derivatives policies and processes to other departments.

Job Summary

Implements market risk analysis and participates in implementing risk management systems and processes to minimize market risk. Applies experience and seasoned knowledge, skills, and practices to perform a variety of assignments.
